posts.post_content: Yeah took me a sec to realize how good this guy is, but he is good. Turn 5 he's basically a 12/8 flying trampler. But come on, you gotta run protection for this guy, which means you have to splash. Which also means you may not have the right mana for your Turn 5 Level 8. This guy's pretty mythic in the fact that once he get's going he's crazy with the damage, but you better have that counterspell or two handy.

Posted By: Robert_G (4/24/2010 2:29:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I disagree with coyotemoon722. This creature doesn't need protecting to be good.  
  
He's a fantastic removal magnet.  
He's a two-drop that, if unanswered, can win you the game.   
He lets you commit powerful creatures to the board early without fear of overextending.   
And he's a great top-deck late game.  
  
No reasonable opponent will let him get to his ultimate form, obviously, but that your opponent \*has\* to do something to not die to what started out as a 2/2 for RR is good.  
  
So in the end he's rarely going to be the star of the show. But he's rarely irrelevant.
posts.html:
I disagree with coyotemoon722. This creature doesn't need protecting to be good.

He's a fantastic removal magnet.
He's a two-drop that, if unanswered, can win you the game.
He lets you commit powerful creatures to the board early without fear of overextending.
And he's a great top-deck late game.

No reasonable opponent will let him get to his ultimate form, obviously, but that your opponent *has* to do something to not die to what started out as a 2/2 for RR is good.

So in the end he's rarely going to be the star of the show. But he's rarely irrelevant.

Posted By: ninjaboy05 (4/26/2010 4:12:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really dig this card, it's probably my favorite from the RoE expansion. It's pretty much a huge fire breathing dragon on an installment payment plan. Pay a little bit up front to put it in play and then as turns progress any spare red mana producing sources left untapped after playing whatever it is you wanted to play that turn can be put towards leveling up Kargan. This works well since they made him so cheap to cast and dirt cheap to level up that pretty much any mostly red or mono red deck will be able to level him up a bit almost every turn with whatever unused mana production sources are left at the end of the turn.   
  
So yeah, I like him. He's won me a few FNM matches already and the only real complaint I could make about him is that his creature type doesn't change from Human Warrior to Dragon as he levels up, so Crucible of Fire or any other dragon buffer does nothing for him. If he had a Dragon creature type he'd be solid gold in my book.
posts.html:
I really dig this card, it's probably my favorite from the RoE expansion. It's pretty much a huge fire breathing dragon on an installment payment plan. Pay a little bit up front to put it in play and then as turns progress any spare red mana producing sources left untapped after playing whatever it is you wanted to play that turn can be put towards leveling up Kargan. This works well since they made him so cheap to cast and dirt cheap to level up that pretty much any mostly red or mono red deck will be able to level him up a bit almost every turn with whatever unused mana production sources are left at the end of the turn.

So yeah, I like him. He's won me a few FNM matches already and the only real complaint I could make about him is that his creature type doesn't change from Human Warrior to Dragon as he levels up, so Crucible of Fire or any other dragon buffer does nothing for him. If he had a Dragon creature type he'd be solid gold in my book.

posts.post_content:
I still think this card isn't that good at mythic rare, at rare maybe.. realistically its still a slow leveler that can only be leveled in red mana and is actually worse than sveral similiar cards you could be playing for the same mana. It also dies to anything, which normally wouldn't matter so much, except you have to sink so much mana into it. With smother in standard I just plain wouldn't play this.
  
   
I could see more application with time of heroes.

posts.post_content:
The thing is, this card works in RDW as two things.
  
   
1. Removal Magnet- if anything screams Path/Doom Blade/Condemn me, it's this. One removal card on this is one less on your Ball Lightning next turn.
  
   
2. Mana investment- RDW goes into top deck mode pretty soon. This acts not as a primary win con, but a mana dump when you have nothing else to play/unearth. Thus, ideally and eventually, it becomes a big threat when you have no more cards.
posts.html:
